As we make sense of our lives, we cast ourselves as the protagonist in an ongoing narrative, surrounded by supporting characters.The structure of fiction almost certainly proceeds from our tendency to do this. I'm not stricken with cancer, nor has any member of my family ever been, but I don't think the American Cancer Society would turn down my offer of support in helping fight the issue because of this reason.
